There may not have been any place for Karim Benzema in Didier Deschamps' France World Cup squad, but the Real Madrid striker has been playing some summer football in Kuwait.

He was invited to the Al Roudan futsal tournament and played well, netting a couple of skilful goals.

The fans in attendance were excited to see the four-time Champions League winner and showed their appreciation whenever he had the ball.

http://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2018/06/04/5b1501c3e5fdeafd2b8b461a.html

Schalke interested in signing Kovacic

Real Madrid can't afford to weaken their midfield any further, yet that hasn't deterred Schalke in their bid to sign Mateo Kovacic with the German club strongly interested in the Croatian.

The 2017/18 season wasn't the most productive for the former Internazionale midfielder, although injuries did curtain his progress in the early part of the season.

Interest in Kovacic remains high with Schalke just one of a number of clubs monitoring his situation.

http://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2018/06/04/5b14509c46163fa2508b45f0.html

Neymar still believes in Real Madrid miracle move

Real Madrid and Barcelona battle for Pascu after Valencia's contract blunder


Valencia have made a huge mistake with regards to the contract of promising youth player Jose Pascual Alba, known as Pascu.

They believed the 18-year-old midfielder's contract would run until 2019, but it actually expires at the end of this month and he can now leave the club on a free.

Given his impressive performances with their youth teams and in first-team training, he was already a highly sought-after player and now Real Madrid and Barcelona will battle to secure his signature.

Pochettino no longer Real Madrid's leading candidate


http://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2018/06/05/5b1595bb46163f62278b45a6.html

Real Madrid's Nagelsmann interest 'logical'


Former Hoffenheim assistant Alfred Schreuder says Real Madrid's reported interest in Julian Nagelsmann would be a logical move.

Julian Nagelsmann would be a logical choice as Real Madrid's next head coach, according to former assistant Alfred Schreuder.

The 30-year-old head coach has been heavily linked with a host of jobs across Europe after turning Hoffenheim into top-four regulars in the Bundesliga.

Nagelsmann's achievements reportedly led to Arsenal, Chelsea, Bayern Munich and Borussia Dortmund all showing an interest, with Madrid the latest side said to be linked following Zinedine Zidane's departure.

Reports have suggested an approach has been rejected, but Schreuder believes Nagelsmann would be a good choice for the European champions.

"I'm not surprised that Real asked," Schreuder told Bild. "All the top clubs in Europe know what he does and keep an eye on him. That's only logical for me.

"He would be 100 per cent be able to deal with [Madrid's superstars]. If he speaks and explains something, they immediately feel that he is a special trainer. That he knows [what he is doing] and is a winner.

"Julian is the best, I've never seen someone that has so much quality."

Real Madrid: "Casilla wanted to hit Zidane" over Luca debut

A Spanish journalist says Kiko Casilla was involved in a furious exchange with Real Madrid's former coach over his omission against Villarreal.

Kiko Casilla was involved in a furious exchange with Zinedine Zidane over the then-Real Madrid coach's decision to pick his son in goal in last month's LaLiga match against Villarreal, a Spanish journalist has claimed.

However, Casilla's camp has denied the report.

Luca Zidane, 20, was handed his Real debut in the 2-2 draw, leading Casilla, who is understudy to number-one keeper Keylor Navas, to miss out on a rare start.

Casilla "wanted to hit Zidane", claims El Chiringuito journo
Speaking on the TV show El Chiringuito on Monday, Cristóbal Soria said Casilla "wanted to hit Zidane" over his team selection at the Estadio de la Cerámica.

Soria also reported that the 31-year-old's omission saw him lose out on a 600,000-euro bonus for reaching an appearances target.

"Kiko had no objections," counters spokesperson for keeper
In the wake of Soria's claims, a spokesperson for the ex-Espanyol custodian offered a contrasting version of events, explaining: "Zinedine told him [Casilla] that, since Luca was the only squad member who had not yet played a single minute [in the 2017/18 season], he was going to field him against Villarreal.

"Kiko understood that and had no objections.

"It's [also] not true that Kiko would have earned a bonus of 600,000 euros if he had played in that game. The bonus that he has [in his contract] is a different amount, and he still had quite a few more games to go to trigger it."

AC Milan keen to sign Dani Ceballos with contact initiated

Dani Ceballos is one of the players in Real Madrid's squad who has seen offers roll in for him in recent weeks. It doesn't seem like he is in Real Madrid's fans after a paltry debut season at the Santiago Bernabeu. The offers are coming in from far and wide and he is wanted outside of Spain with Napoli interest among others.

Sky Sports emphasise AC Milan's interest in the player and say he is of their priorities. They say the Italian club have initiated contact with the player and it seems an agreement could be made quite quickly for the transfer of the player.

replies.msg:
Real Madrid candidates | Who could replace Zinedine Zidane?

Mauricio Pochettino
The 46-year-old is admired for turning Tottenham Hotspur into a top four side in England, having also caught the eye at Southampton and Espanyol. Likely to top early shortlist drafts, although there is a feeling he will be too hard to lure from Spurs.

Massimiliano Allegri
Has enjoyed a successful spell at Juventus, where he has won the title for a second successive year. Said he intended to stay in Italy earlier this month. That, though, was before the Real Madrid job became available and the 50-year-old could be tempted.

Arsene Wenger
Out of work for the first time in 22 years following an emotional end to his Arsenal reign, the vastly experienced Frenchman is believed to have reservations about taking the Real Madrid job, while they would only turn to him as a fall back option.

Antonio Conte
His Chelsea exit has been on the cards for months, despite the fact he has won both the Premier League and the FA Cup during his two years in London. Also won the title in Italy with Juventus and is well respected in Spain.

Maurizio Sarri
Another Italian who is likely to be included in Real’s conversations. Is out of work after an impressive spell in charge of Napoli and is thought to be the favourite to succeed Conte at Chelsea.

https://www.telegraph.co.uk

Cristiano's declarations to World Soccer were picked by beIN Sports France; the Real Madrid forward picked club team mate Marco Asensio as the player he expects to shine on the world stage during the next few years.

Kluivert and Guti in running for St. Mirren manager role


Following claims from the BBC that former Real Madrid player Guti is a key candidate to take over at Scottish outfit St Mirren another former international has been added to the fray as another potential candidate on the Love Street bench following the departure of former coach Jack Ross to English side Sunderland

The appointment of Guti at St Mirren is now more of a doubt given the shock resignation last week by Zinedine Zidane as the former Juvenil coach in the running to replace the French coach after many of the favourites (Pochettino, Low and Allegri) ruled themselves out of the position and Guti himself anxious to face a "fresh challenge" in his management career.

Former Dutch international Kluivert is the latest name to be linked with a move to the Scottish side and the Paisley based outfit must do their best to lure him away from his current role as sporting director at Ligue 1 side Paris Saint-Germain.

Michel and Laudrup lead Real Madrid's B plan


With Pochettino and Klopp ruled out, Allegri and Conte difficult, it has meant that Real Madrid have had to look at other options, a plan B, which means a coach with a similar profile to Zinedine Zidane who played for the club, that likes quality football and is ready for the challenge.

The two candidates that fit this concept are Michel and Michael Laudrup, who both played at the Bernabeu at the latter stages of their careers (1994-96). Michel started at Madrid aged just 13 in 1976 and became a club legend, while Laudrup, remembered for his elegancy on the pitch, had a briefer spell.

Other names that have been put forward are Clarence Seedorf, who has already coached AC Milan, and Fernando Hierro.

http://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2018/06/07/5b18f42646163f46688b461a.html
Kovacic is an alternative for Manchester City if they don't sign Jorginho according to Sky Sports.

Madrid prepared to pay Oblak's 100M release clause claim A Bola


With limited movement in the transfer market so far, Portuguese sports daily A Bola claim that Real Madrid are set to make the first splash of the summer and are prepared to pay the 100 million euro buy-out clause that would see Jan Oblak make the move from the Metropolitano to the Santiago Bernabeu and become the highest paid goalkeeper in the process.

The final decision claim A Bola, will lie with the future Real Madrid coach as the search for a replacement for Zinedina Zidane continues.

MARCELO: REAL'S DOOR OPEN FOR NEYMAR

Real Madrid want Cristiano Ronaldo to stay, but "the door is always be open" for Neymar, says Marcelo.

"Cristiano Ronaldo doesn't own Real Madrid, so it's not because he's there that Neymar can't be brought in," he said.

"All of the players want him to stay, but the door is always open for Neymar to join.

"I think the best players in the world have to play at Real Madrid, and I already said for two or three years that, for me, one day Neymar will be there."

MADRID WERE CLOSE TO LEMAR

Real Madrid were closing in on the signing of Monaco midfielder Thomas Lemar before the departure of Zinedine Zidane last week, reports L’Equipe.

The France international had reportedly already informed Zidane of his willingness to move to the Bernabeu and he would have been one of Madrid’s first signings of the summer in a deal worth around €60m.

The 22-year-old has been linked heavily with the European champions’ domestic rivals Atletico Madrid and Barcelona in recent weeks.

replies.msg: Real Madrid have approached Brazilian coach Tite to replace Zinedine Zidane. [Rádio Sagres 730]

Akinfenwa hits out at Ramos: I'll never play against you, you're lucky

For Adebayo Akinfenwa, Sergio Ramos is fully to blame for Mohamed Salah's injury in the Champions League final and the Real Madrid captain is fortunate that he'll never face him.

Admitting that he will never get to the Champions League to square up to Ramos, the 36-year-old English striker, known affectionately as 'The Beast', ripped up a football boot to express his emotion.

Ending the video with a sly chuckle, Akinfenwa also took aim at the centre-back for causing a concussion to goalkeeper Loris Karius in Los Blancos' 3-1 win over his boyhood team Liverpool in Kiev.

http://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2018/06/08/5b1a8319e2704e5e068b45e2.html
